intro: Ceropegia chimanimaniensis, commonly known as the Chimanimani milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are often visited by specific pollinators. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a distinctive, waxy texture. It is adapted to grow in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats.
